tweets.html:
The #BB15 hamsters will be celebrating Canada Day today by sharing their most offensive Newfie jokes on the live feed.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 1, 2013

Half-time top 5: 1. Bunheads 2. Bunheads 3. Bunheads 4. Bunheads 5 (tie). Bunheads; Bunheads. (This goes for every medium.)

— Zach üö∑ (@zhaldeman) July 1, 2013

To round out the top 10: 6. Bunheads 7. Bunheads 8. Bunheads 9. Bunheads 10. Bunheads. Jeez it's been a great 6 months for entertainment.

— Zach üö∑ (@zhaldeman) July 1, 2013

Achievements of human civilization, top 5: 1. Bunheads 2. Bunheads 3. Bunheads 4. Bunheads 5. Bunheads. Pretty good run so far.

— Zach üö∑ (@zhaldeman) July 1, 2013

There's also an orchestral soundtrack for #DowntonAbbey. Sadly, none of the tracks are called, "Really, Cousin Matthew? REALLY?"

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 1, 2013

Earthquakes, massive heat waves, constant rain‚Ä¶God is so not happy that they canceled @HappyEndingsABC

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 1, 2013

Why is the Mark Burnett-produced, NBC-aired sequel to The Bible not called The Bible 2: Back in the Habit?

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 1, 2013

In the Bible reboot, Jesus comes down off the cross and slaughters the Romans, but then feels bad about it afterward.

— John Scalzi (@scalzi) July 1, 2013

I really like @macklemore but his name is something Moe would've called Curly: "Hey Macklemore put down that Bunsen burner".

— Phil Rosenthal (@PhilRosenthal) July 1, 2013

Stories like "Vatican Money Laundering" make me very sad not to be writing a con and heist show anymore ...

— John Rogers (@jonrog1) July 1, 2013

‚ÄúBig Brother‚Äù is an anagram for ‚ÄúSteaming Pile of Shit‚Äù RT @AriFerarri: Guys, did you know Aaryn is an anagram for Aryan? #BB15 #AarynNation

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 1, 2013

New theme song for "Ray Donovan" set to the tune of "Ed Sullivan" from "Bye Bye Birdie." Please, thanks.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 1, 2013

Has any woman ever actually stared pensively at herself in the mirror and then cut her own hair with like, kitchen shears? Stop it, TV.

— Margaret Lyons (@margeincharge) July 1, 2013

Dear Media - fyi, unarmed black kids are shot in America every day. You're free to cover those trials, too.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) July 1, 2013

@scalzi And the burning bush turns out to just be a lens flare.

— Chris Bohn (@DocBohn) July 1, 2013

What is Netflix really asking me here. pic.twitter.com/iBTr5ZcBCx

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 1, 2013

If an Elvis impersonator dies, doesn't he kind of become the best Elvis impersonator

— Chase Mitchell (@ChaseMit) July 1, 2013

The Hollywood Reporter is calling The Lone Ranger "an adaption radio of and television serial." More please me tell!

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 1, 2013

I'm pretty sure Skins is entirely created for the purpose of teaching media studies semiotics classes. So meticulously constructed.

— Hannah Ellison (@hanellison) July 1, 2013

I think the Happy Endings cancellation shows how wrong our growing assumption that good, canceled shows will be picked up elsewhere can be.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 1, 2013

Help, I left Extra on for two minutes after the NBC Nightly News ended and found out that Jessica Simpson pronounces the K in Knute

— Ben Jacobs (@benhjacobs) July 1, 2013

What difference does it make? Are you planning on burgling me? RT @NikkiFinke: Heading out of town?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 2, 2013

I'm watching Seinfeld on pain killers. This is like if Heaven had commercials.

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) July 2, 2013

Jesus, CNN has a show called "The N-Word Special." My chest. I CAN'T DO THIS TODAY.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) July 1, 2013

tweets.html:
CNN vs. journalism class at remedial high school: which is worse? pic.twitter.com/LWBbfoJS8w

— The Ghost of Eric D. Snider Past (@EricDSnider) July 1, 2013

Since we're all raggin' on CNN, this actually happened this afternoon. I can't even. pic.twitter.com/UIZWmmX9cw

— Isaac (@WorldofIsaac) July 1, 2013

Oh you guys want more CNN hilarity? How about a multiple choice of honky, cracker, nigger. pic.twitter.com/dP08M4P5KO

— Isaac (@WorldofIsaac) July 1, 2013

Based on tweets alone I am now slow clapping CNN.

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) July 1, 2013

Waiting for Fox News to counter with a special on "The C Word"

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) July 1, 2013

CNN-word

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) July 1, 2013

Someone important at CNN must be a really big fan of First Take.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 2, 2013

Wait, people aren't talking about "cracker" when they say "the c-word"?

— Kyle Ryan (@Kyle_Ryan) July 2, 2013

#NextonCNN "Are Team Jacob supporters worse than Holocaust deniers?"

— Jessica Ritchey (@Ruby_Stevens) July 1, 2013

CNN: WHICH IS WORSE -- FORGETTING YOUR KEYS INSIDE THE CAR OR FORGETTING YOUR BABY INSIDE THE CAR ON A 90-DEGREE DAY?

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) July 2, 2013

Next on CNN: Which is worse? Watching 30 minutes of CNN or watching 24 hours of Stefan Urquelle-centric Family Matters episodes?

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 2, 2013

What's worse: The N-Word, or the mystery slur behind Door #2?

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) July 2, 2013

BRING BACK OFAY. Seriously, if we're going to pretend that anti-white racism is a thing, let's at least be jazz cats.

— Angus Johnston (@studentactivism) July 2, 2013

@anamariecox CNN would get more cutting analysis from GOB and Franklin

— Michael Crawford (@MiklCraw4d) July 2, 2013

Had a great dinner at the C*****r Barrel

— blurdia blurgan (@blaudiablogan) July 2, 2013

BBC News: Cracker vs. Prime Suspect, Which One is Better?

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) July 2, 2013

Every cable news channel should have an hour a day of anchors and reporters sitting around saying, "DUHHH! DUHHHHH!" Call the show "DUH".

— John Moe (@johnmoe) July 2, 2013

Did we need confirmation that Armisen left SNL? Didn't Armisen's last SNL confirm Armisen was leaving SNL?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))üìé (@arrabin56) July 2, 2013

That part where Fred Armisen was clearly leaving "SNL" was supposed to be when we knew he was leaving.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 1, 2013

Why does no one care about my #Spartacus phallus tweets?

— Unbreakable Peter (@Loki1001) July 2, 2013

I've eaten about a thousand calories all day and am feeling cranky as hell. So this is why so many actresses are so mean all the time.

— Zack Stentz (@MuseZack) July 2, 2013

2 Broke Girls is Laverne and Shirley for girls who say "yolo."

— Vanessa Ramos (@thatRamosgirl) July 2, 2013

"How's a beer sound, Norm?" "I don't know Coach, I usually finish 'em before they get a word in."

— Sophie üåπ (@insopherable) July 2, 2013

Tween shows on TV are basically the "before" mugshots that TMZ digs up later.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 2, 2013

Easily the best thing that happened on twitter tonight http://t.co/6P6UypFTz0

— andy levy (@andylevy) July 2, 2013

Drew's dad's a "recovered alcoholic." I'm sure he's also delighted to have sloppy, drunken parking described on national TV. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 2, 2013

Drew's dad is not just a recovered alcoholic, he's a recovered alcoholic with cancer. I feel a pity rose coming on. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 2, 2013

We're pretty much assuming record-low ratings for "Siberia" tonight, right? Like... 37 viewers? Give or take?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 2, 2013

So does the name Siberia have anything to do with the content of the show, or is it simply NBC's ratings prediction?

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) July 2, 2013

Darnit. "Siberia" stole my idea for the competition show, "Hang Out In Russian Doing Nothing."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 2, 2013

I have to assume "Siberia" was the cheapest network TV program ever made. So... Kudos.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 2, 2013

Been wondering all day about those folks UNDER THE DOME. I wonder what's going on in there. Too bad the 2 BROKE GIRLS aren't in there also.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 1, 2013

It's such a shame TV in general can't be more creative, like an episode of MIKE AND MOLLY where they are inexplicably trapped under a dome.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 1, 2013

Other TV characters I'd like to see inexplicably trapped UNDER THE DOME for one episode: Allison Williams, the Good Wife, CSI: Anything.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 1, 2013

Gordon Ramsey forced to cook UNDER THE DOME, inadvertently marinating his guests on KITCHEN NIGHTMARES with a rich smokey flavor.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 1, 2013

I love it when Stephen King reveals that he's done some research and then has a character tell us about it... #UndertheDome

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 2, 2013

Being UNDER THE DOME has caused a pacemaker to explode, suggesting they are all actually trapped in a 7-11 burrito microwave.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 2, 2013

Why is it Under *the* Dome? There could be other domes.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 2, 2013

So far no one seems to have considered tunneling under the dome in UNDER THE DOME. Stephen King hasn't gotten that sloppy, has he?

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 2, 2013

Every episode of this show should end with someone on their knees, yelling "Dooooome!!!!!" at the dome.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 2, 2013

Best part of UNDER THE DOME so far--sporadic radio reception that somehow always contains relevant exposition.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 2, 2013

Local CBS news station wants to know if I'm "prepared for a disaster"....like getting trapped UNDER THE DOME?!

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 2, 2013

The dome is the Vera Farmiga of Under the Dome

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 2, 2013

Week two of forgetting to watch Under The Dome. Are they still under the dome? Are they totally over the dome? Anyone had sex with the dome?

— Sean O'Neal (@seanoneal) July 2, 2013

They should have retooled Up All Night to have it take place under a dome.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 2, 2013

"How long should we leave the dome on?" - quote from my new series, "Above the Dome." #abovethedone

— John (@Notgiamatti) July 2, 2013

under the dome/is a town set in maine/under the dome/is all hank's propane... no no NO! you can do better mongew! #UnderTheDomeParodyLyrics

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) July 2, 2013

UNDER THE DOME is like Stephen King said "THE MIST was good and all, but needs to be way longer. With no monsters. And TERRIBLE DIALOGUE."

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) July 2, 2013

UNDER THE DOME is like CBS said "Hey, remember JERICHO? Remember how good it looked, and how much fun it was? Let's do that again. But not."

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) July 2, 2013
